quest.name: The Admiral's Resolve
journal: Alphinaud is eager to deliver the good tidings to Limsa Lominsa.
objectives: Speak with Zanthael on the lower decks of Limsa Lominsa.
Speak with the leaders of Limsa Lominsa's pirate powers.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Let's see: brilliant minds, rapier wits, humor drier than Thanalan... Appearances aside, I'd say the two Matoyas are mirror images of each other.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: As I followed your deeds through history, I came across the names of a great many distinguished individuals such as Commander Hext and Master Matoya, and it has been a delight to meet them in the flesh. I heartily look forward to making the acquaintance of the rest, not least the Azure Dragoon!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: My apologies, but I will rest here awhile. Go on without me.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well then, my friends, let us return to Limsa Lominsa and deliver the good news to the Admiral. A word to the officer in Bulwark Hall should be sufficient to secure us an audience.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though the Admiral is not expecting us, I am certain she will want to hear our report. Come, let us request an audience.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If we offer them the means to cure their tempered, the beast tribes are far more likely to listen.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Even as we speak, we are weaving a new future. And when it all becomes history, I hope that those who follow may look back with gladness.

dialogue.name: ZANTHAEL
dialogue.text: Why, [GC Rank] SurnameForename, ever a welcome sight.

dialogue.name: ZANTHAEL
dialogue.text: ...Tidings for the Admiral, you say? She is presently receiving guests, but for the Scions, I know she will make an exception. Follow me.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: My friends... What brings you here this day?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Is this true!?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: By the Navigator... A cure for tempering.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: As often as I've been in awe of you Scions, I would not have thought it possible...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And yet it is, Admiral. We have done it. Here in Limsa. And production of more familiars has already begun.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: You have my thanks. Truly. This will do much to advance the cause of peace. Yet I fear it will take more to close the rift 'twixt man and beastman.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Bah, even to speak thus divides us.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: <sigh> Welcome as it is, a cure will not guarantee reconciliation between our peoples. For though summoning and the tempered may serve to fuel the conflict, they are but symptoms of it.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: If we are to resolve the primal problem once and for all, we must address the cause. We must strive for mutual understanding and find a way to leave our bloody past behind.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: ...'Twas I who moved that the Alliance renew its push for peace.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Since our ancestors came to these shores some seven centuries past, we Lominsans have been at odds with those who share our island home.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Save for a brief moment of cooperation with the kobolds, our history has been one of nigh-constant territorial squabbling.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, our struggle with the Sahagin for control over the seas has only grown fiercer. A matter made worse by the thrice-damned Calamity driving them to seek new spawning grounds...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: With survival at stake, each had no choice but to fight. And so I dismissed peace as impossible.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: “Impossible is a word coined by the weak,” I proclaimed to all who'd listen─and then gave up. You and yours put me to shame.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Since you led us to victory against the Black Wolf, you have achieved the impossible again and again and again.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And I thought it high time that I followed suit. Hence my proposal to the Alliance council.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But no sooner did I reach out to our neighbors in Vylbrand than my own people sought to thwart me.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You speak of the pirates who failed to attend the meeting.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Aye. Acting through a friendly faction among the kobolds, we had intended to seek an audience with a prominent patriarch.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But the Bloody Executioners would not hear of it, and their absence sent a message to the rest.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Though they are but one of the three pirate powers, they are the greatest, and any attempt at peace would founder without them.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I am given to understand that their leader, Captain Hyllfyr, has been bedridden for some while with an ailment of the lungs.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Correct. In his absence, his right hand leads, a man named Sicard but recently risen to prominence among their ranks.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Save for his disdain for authority, little is known about him. We have invited him to speak with us more than once, but he will not come.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I have tasked the Yellowjackets and the rogues with uncovering his motives, but they have learned naught of any value.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Leave it to us.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We have a nose for the truth. Whatever this Sicard wants, we'll find out.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We have a nose for the truth. Whatever this Sicard wants, I'm sure we could find out.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Truly? I would be much obliged.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I shall look forward to hearing what you learn, then. Good luck.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The Admiral is right─the cause of the conflict needs to be addressed. We'll do what we can to ease the way, but it ultimately falls to the Lominsans to make peace with their neighbors.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I know naught of this city save what I've read or heard in passing. So in this matter, I will follow your lead.

dialogue.name: ZANTHAEL
dialogue.text: So you will be looking into Sicard for us, will you? I wish you luck...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: By way of a first step, I suggest we split up and make inquiries around town. Someone must know this Sicard.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If you could approach the pirates, Forename, the rest of us will seek out merchants and adventurers.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Curious about Sicard, are you? As am I, my friend, as am I.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Sadly, I know nothing of the man─save that the Bloody Executioners experienced a marked improvement in their fortunes after his promotion.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Quite how he achieved this is a matter of some debate.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: As you know, the thalassocracy permits us to attack only Garlean vessels, yet these have all but vanished from the seas since the Empire turned in upon itself.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: In order to adapt, we Krakens have taken to trading with the East, but the Executioners are less...forward looking. I cannot imagine they would willingly abandon the old ways.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: So how, then, are they lining their coffers? ...Whatever their secret, they are not like to share it with their rivals, but mayhap you will have more luck.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Eh? Ye want to know about Sicard? 'E's a wily bugger is what 'e is.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Found some clever way to make coin, they say, an' traded it fer Moenskaet's place at ol' Hyllfyr's side.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: There was a time we raced the Executioners fer our pick of the Empire's fleet, but the Garleans are gone, an' them days with 'em.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Owin' to which, we've all of us had to look fer other ways to make ends meet─with that jumped-up bilge rat Sicard landin' the juiciest, whatever it may be.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Not that we Sirens are strugglin', mind... We do well enough guardin' fishin' boats from the fishbacks an' other beasties.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Get the first pick o' the produce fer our trouble, see. Quality stuff at a bargain price.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: This we pass to our sisters as can't sail on account o' gettin' old or wounded or with child, an' they cook it up an' sell it for a pretty profit. Simple!

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Oh, I miss the old ways, don't get me wrong. But when I see the girls with their little ones, I think to meself: a life o' peace an' quiet ain't all bad.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: I have told you all I know of Sicard. Should you learn how the Bloody Executioners are lining their coffers, you will share their secrets with me, I trust?

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: If you 'ear 'ow that scrawny whelp's makin' that much coin, you tell me, all right? I'll make it worth yer while.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As I went about making my inquiries, I chanced upon a shop that boasted a rather enticing selection of sweetmeats. Perhaps we could take Ga Bu and G'raha there one day?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Walking through the city, one would never suspect this was until recently a bastion of piracy. The Admiral is to be commended for overseeing so swift a transformation.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I see everyone has returned. Now, who would like to go first?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So, just as their imperial prey began to disappear, Sicard turned the Executioners' fortunes around with a mysterious new source of income...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Whatever it is, it's nothing to scoff at. According to a tavern keeper I spoke to, the crew have been indulging themselves as never before. But no amount of drink seems to loosen their tongues as to how they are coming by their coin.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: For my part, I spoke with a reporter from the Harbor Herald. The publication has been investigating the secret of the Executioners' good fortune, and making little headway.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Plainly, the Executioners do not wish the nature of their business to be made public.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...And I think I may know why. In the course of making inquiries on Hawkers' Alley, an interesting fact came to light. Just as the Executioners began to enjoy better fortunes, the price of crystal went into sharp decline─a sudden fall in demand, I was told.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Curious, I contacted Hoary Boulder, who has been watching the movements of the beast tribes. And my suspicions were proven correct.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Despite ever-worsening relations between the beast tribes and the thalassocracy, neither Titan nor Leviathan have made an appearance of late, suggesting that the kobolds and Sahagin lack the means with which to summon them.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Do you mean to say the Executioners are divesting them of their crystals?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: All indications point to that conclusion, yes─though we have no hard evidence as yet. We must investigate further.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Agreed. So how do we proceed?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Oh, I have an idea about that. In fact, I have already taken the liberty of making certain provisions.
